definition:
In general, a *$C_2$-category* is an $\mathcal{A}b4$-category, or,
alternatively, an $\mathcal{A}b3$- and $\mathcal{A}b3^*$ -category $\C$
with certain additional conditions for the canonical morphism from
direct sums to products of any family of objects in $\mathcal{C}$
[@NP288]).

A *$C_2$-category* is defined as a category $\mathcal{C}$ that has
products, coproducts and a zero object, and if the morphism
$\iota : \oplus A_i \to \mathbf{X} A_i $ is a monomorphism for any
family of objects $\left\{A_i\right\}$ in $\mathcal{C}$ (p. 81 in
[@BM266]).

One readily obtains the result that a $C_2$-category is $C_1$
([@BM266]).
